intro: Ardisia verdisepala, commonly known as the green-sepal ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are bright red berries that contain several seeds. Ardisia verdisepala is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
